Adieus it no wonder spirit houses.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="none" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="825" img_size="large" css_animation="bottom-to-top" el_class="homepage-image-intro"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" full_height="yes" css=".vc_custom_1514408004951{border-top-width: 1px !important;background: #0c0b19 url(https://demo-content.kaliumtheme.com/restaurant/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/landscape4.jpg?id=798) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;border-top-color: #eeeeee !important;}" el_class="our-chef" el_id="our-chef"][vc_column width="2/3"][lab_heading title="René Redzepi" el_class="chef-title"]Our Culinary Chef [/lab_heading][vc_single_image image="665" img_size="full" el_class="title-divider"][vc_column_text]René Redzepi, the young chef who elevated Noma in Copenhagen to its standing as best restaurant in the world in the S.Pellegrino World's 50 Best Restaurants rankings, has pioneered a cuisine dubbed "New Nordic."

 

While it may be impolite to wonder aloud about "Old Nordic," the new cuisine is built on local ingredients like sweet green strawberries, musk ox and flowers harvested from the seashore, which tell a Danish tale of "time and place," according to Redzepi.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="443" img_size="full" el_class="signature"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1504179587073{border-top-width: 1px !important;border-bottom-width: 1px !important;padding-bottom: 30px !important;background-image: url(https://demo-content.kaliumtheme.com/restaurant/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/topography.png?id=115) !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: repeat !important;border-top-color: #eeeeee !important;border-top-style: solid !important;border-bottom-color: #eeeeee !important;border-bottom-style: solid !important;}" el_id="menu" el_class="menu-row"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1504178186798{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][lab_heading title="Menu" el_class="restaurant-menu" css=".vc_custom_1503674139359{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]Varieties of our rich menu, a famous Michelin star restaurant.
Veggies es bonus vobis, proinde vos postulo essum magis kohlrabi welsh onion daikon amaranth tatsoi tomatillo.
[/lab_heading][vc_single_image image="665" img_size="full" el_class="title-divider centered"][vc_tta_tabs style="theme-styled-minimal" alignment="center" active_section="1" el_class="restaurant-menu"][vc_tta_section title="Breakfast" tab_id="breakfast"][vc_row_inner el_class="menu-catalog"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_custom_heading text="Omelettes" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502194114618{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Omelette Mariachi

Jalapeños, bell pepper, mushroom & coriander.

4.5€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502194132235{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Pesto Omelette

Smoked chicken, tomato.

5.5€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502194138467{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Big ben

English type of breakfast, two eggs.

6€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_custom_heading text="Sandwiches" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502193845009{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Crunchy

Chicken crunchy meat with seasonal vegetables.

3€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502282418283{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Veggie*

For all the vegetarians, mixed forest vegetables.

2.5€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502194209962{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Traditional

Homemade sandwich with albanian bread.

2.5€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner el_class="menu-catalog"][vc_column_inner][vc_custom_heading text="Soups" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502196452472{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Classic

Toss your favorite pasta and veggies into an anything-goes pot of hot chicken soup.

3€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502196437768{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Tomato Soup

This is a stick-to-your-ribs meal in a bowl. Add some crunchy garlic bread and you're good to go!

2€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Lunch" tab_id="lunch"][vc_row_inner el_class="menu-catalog"][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_custom_heading text="Chicken" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502192366292{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Mojopicon Chicken

Served with pasta, pepper sauce and mediterranean olives.

9€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502193271099{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Chicken Schnitzel

Breaded and fried chiclen filet, served with mushroom sauce.

11€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502192483124{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Stroganoff

Served with rice, boiled vegetables and hot chili sauce.

8.5€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_custom_heading text="Steak" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502193133364{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

T-Bone Steak

Keeping the original recipe from Argentina beef.

22€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502193139822{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Kalium Steak

Our special steak dish, served with hot pepper sauce.

14€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502192987238{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Zwiebel Steak

Grilled filet mignon with roasted onions and veggies.

13.5€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_custom_heading text="Fish" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502192569108{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Grilled Calamari

Calamari from the shores of Adriatic, served with vegetables.

15€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502192723819{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Sea Bass Grill

Fresh potatoes and pomodorini with greek spices.

18€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502192825811{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Fourchu Lobster

The most special fish dish you can get, grilled and boiled.

24€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Dinner" tab_id="dinner"][vc_row_inner el_class="menu-catalog"][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_custom_heading text="Sushi" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502194655868{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Uramaki Roll

Rice is on the outside and seaweed wraps around the filling

9€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502194637316{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Sashimi

Fish or shellfish served alone (no rice).

15€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502194674769{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Temaki

Sushi that has been hand-rolled into a cone shape.

9.5€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_custom_heading text="Pasta" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195151040{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Ravioli con Broccoli

Broccoli served ravioli to stay healthy.

10€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195018872{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Tagliatelle Spinach

Served with spinach and gorgonzola.

7€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195858883{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Linguini veggie

Italian style linguini with fresh veggies.

11€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_custom_heading text="Main" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195248547{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Shrimp Risotto

Served with fresh sea fruits and veggies.

8€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195345140{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Mussels á Provence

Provence style mussel done in red wine.

12€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195427972{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Étouffée

Typically served with shellfish over smothered rice.

10€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_custom_heading text="Wines" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195662397{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Riesling

From the classic German grape of the Rhine and Mosel.

78€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195715199{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Chardonnay

Sparkling, the principle white wine of Burgundy.

68€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502195901005{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Cabernet

Widely accepted as one of the world’s best varieties.

85€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Desserts" tab_id="desserts"][vc_row_inner el_class="menu-catalog"][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_custom_heading text="Sweets" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502115973920{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Panna Cota

Cooked cream may be aromatized with vanilla and other flavorings.

5€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502115981006{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Tiramisu

Eggs, sugar, and mascarpone cheese, flavoured with cocoa from Italy.

7€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502115985661{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Mango Sorbet

Dessert consisting of frozen mango juice or flavored water and sugar.

3.5€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_custom_heading text="Cakes" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502116631042{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Soufflé

Chocolate baked egg-based dish from France.

7€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502116638053{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Black Sesami

Sesame is a flowering plant in the genus served with sweets.

4€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502116642857{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Cheesecake

Sweet dessert consisting cream cheese, eggs and sugar with berries.

5€[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_custom_heading text="Fruits" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502117172056{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Orange Punch

Punch made of oranges from Greece with the best old recipe.

5€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502117282915{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Melon mix

Watermelon, sweet melon, corn melon sliced and frozen.

7€[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="food-list" css=".vc_custom_1502117390043{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

Forest Fruits

Handpicked fruits one by one from the wild forests of Asia.

item.title: Mini Creamy Chicken Noodle Bread Bowls
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
It’s soup season! Arlind and I are eating every bowl of ramen we come across and we’re still not ramen-ed out because how could anyone get tired of carbs and soup? Speaking of carbs and soup, I made this gem before we left: creamy chicken noodle soup in baby bread bowls. [caption id="attachment_136" align="alignleft" width="454"] Procedure begins...[/caption] I’ve been wanting to do something in bread bowls forever because I love the idea of edible dishes and nothing beats a bread bowl. Do you guys remember your first ever? Mine was in SF: the classic sourdough clam chowder. I had my first bread bowl late in life, in my twenties. And actually, my first ever bread bowl was eaten with Mike during our first ever vacation together. That’s a lot of firsts… Anyway, I was going to do clam chowder but instead wanted to something that was just a bit different, but not too different. Mike and I were chatting about the different kinds of soup that we could make: broccoli and cheddar. I remarked that they were all brown or white and wondered why there weren’t any variations in color. Mike mentioned clear soup, like chicken and then I thought of creamy chicken and miso and here we are. Not the most exciting story, but sometimes all you want is creamy comfort. [gallery link="file" size="medium" ids="800,798,796"] This soup comes together quickly, which is always nice, especially if you need to warm up after being outside. I popped it into some La Brea Bakery Take & Bake French Dinner rolls, which I picked up at the Walmart in the frozen aisle – super convenient. Creamy chicken, a hint of miso, and mini round noodles in a hot and crispy bread bowl? I’m never going outside again :)

item.title: Preparing Charcuterie and Cheese at Home
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I love weeknight date-nights in. So cozy and romantic. You get to pick the music, or maybe a movie, light some candles and just chill with your boo or friends. My favorite way to do an easy night in is, charcuterie and cheese, of course. Mike and I first discovered our love for charcuterie together. Way back in the day, a hot new restaurant opened in Vancouver, in a literal alley in a very sketchy part of town. It was hipster before being hipster was a thing. They offered flights of meat and cheese for an insane amount of money and we fell in love. [caption id="attachment_170" align="alignleft" width="451"] Here goes the caption[/caption] After our fourth visit there, in 2 weeks, we wised up to the fact that we were spending an absurd amount of money on something that we could easily do at home. After all, the restaurant literally told us where they sourced their charcuterie from – this was way before made-in-house was a thing. So, we went right to the source, bought a bunch of our favorites, which we handily already knew, and went to town. I had the best time coming up with fun little accoutrements. That’s where your creativity can really shine! Pair cheeses and meats with jam, mustards, hot sauces, fruits, herbs, essentially anything you want. We like having a variety of breads and crunchy things too. I’m really into these rye crisps and these crispy crackers and Mike loves toasty bread. We went a little crazy here, for fun, but you do you – you don’t have to go crazy. Sometimes the best thing to do is to stick to one kind of meat, a really good mustard, and some olives. Keep it simple, keep it crazy, keep it you. I made some little flags, for fun, and plated the pate in a restaurant-like fashion. Sometimes when we hit up restaurants, we notice that they smear pate onto a plate, to the edge, to make it pretty, like this. Super easy to do at home and as a bonus it looks kinda sorta homemade ;) Charcuterie Pairing Ideas: • fancy salt:  flaky sea salt, smoke sea salt, flavored salts • finishing spices: shichimi togarashi, red pepper flakes, • citrus fruit zest: orange is particularly nice, as are lemon and lime • mustards: whole grain, dijon, English, Japanese • wasabi • herbs: Thai basil, mint, cilantro (this gives charcuterie a sort of deconstructed banh-mi feel, which we love) • olives • pickles • hot sauce: tabasco, sriracha, sambal oelek Cheese Pairing Ideas: • fruit: thinly sliced pears, apples, cherries, stone fruits • honey • jam: apricot, strawberry, fig, cherry, apple, raspberry, orange marmalade • tomatoes: thinly sliced or cherry tomatoes • seeds and nuts: poppy seeds, toasted sesame seeds, walnuts, macadamias, marcona almonds, pecans, pistachios Of course, feel free to mix and match – go forth and meat and cheese with abandon!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Jujubes chocolate bar apple pie chupa chups bear claw macaroon marshmallow tart. Cake jelly beans cupcake chocolate cookie pastry pudding halvah jujubes. Toffee macaroon oat cake danish fruitcake jelly beans.
